climbs.name: Who's First
climbs.fa: Bill Squires and Craig Parsley, February 1975

content.description:
Unprotected face climbing along scoops and edges in mottled rock gains a slanting hand-crack which starts about halfway up and leads to the top.

Despite the moderate grade the lack of protection at the bottom makes this a popular top-rope or solo and a route which is seldom led.
content.location:
Between

Vaino's Lost in Pot

and

Rhythm of the Heat

.

content.description:
Climbs a left-slanting crack to about the midway point and then continues straight up the featured face above.

Variations to this route exist.
content.location:
Between

Scream Chuck

and

Who's First

.

content.description:
Around and to the right of the popular south face of Pixie Rock is a single crack/flake system on the east-facing side. This goes about 5.7 and the most difficult moves are in the first half. Not popular and not as good as the more aesthetic face climbs on the south face.

Descend as for the other routes.
content.protection: A rack of mid to large cams.
Easily TRed with gear from the horizontal crack on top. Camalot size 1 and smaller.
content.location: Left of 'Silent Scream', right of the easy 5th class ramp. Walk off to the right behind Silent Scream.

climbs.name: Srepopers Roid
climbs.fa: locker, Woody Stark and Dwain Warren, February 2007

content.description:
Starts with a nice but short crack system to some good holds out left on the face to the top...pretty sustained moves throughout.

Access for TR via 4th class approach on back of Pixie formation.
content.location: Around and right from Silent Scream on the East Face. The obvious crack to face system on left.

climbs.name: Silent Scream (aka Shock the Monkey)
climbs.fa: (TR) Alan Nelson and Mike Beck December 1982, FL: unknown

content.description:
A Josh classic! VERY popular route that draws a big crowd. Silent Scream climbs the bucketed face about thirty feet right of Who's First in the center of the SE face of Pixie Rock. Reach up, pull down. A little tricky move at the top keeps it exciting all the way home. Scramble down off the back and set your anchor. Long slings or a couple of cordalettes can be used to run the anchor up and over the top of the route.

Toproping: You can scramble up the back side of Pixie or up the steep slot to the left of the route to set an anchor at the top. Be very careful either way!

The name

Shock The Monkey

comes from a Peter Gabriel song of the same name from his 1982 Security release.
content.protection: 4 bolts (3/8"). Place-your-own anchor. Take a good selection of medium to large cams for the crack in the alcove behind the top of the route.

climbs.name: Silent but Deadly
climbs.fa: Geoff Archer, Louie Anderson and Dave Stoner, February 1990

content.description:
Climb the vertical to slightly bulging face via edges and sloping holds to a shared anchor with

Silent Scream (aka Shock the Monkey)

. The crux is low and over quickly, after which it's just fun and featured face climbing to the top.

Due to the southern orientation and the sloping nature of some holds it's perhaps best done when cold.
content.protection: 3 bolts (3/8"), gear to 3" for the anchor
content.location:
Located on the scooped face just right of

Silent Scream (aka Shock the Monkey)

.

climbs.name: Scream Chuck
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Cyndie Bransford, Doug Avery, 6-1990.

content.description: This is to the right of "Lascivious Conduct" and has the same start. Climb the short crack, then hand traverse right and follow cracks and face to the two bolt anchor.

Slabby face climb just left of Silent Scream. Unlike Silent Scream just to the right, this section of Pixie Rock is almost completely unfeatured. This is a great climb to slap up a TR and get familiar with JT friction climbing. At the mid point, a crack system slants up and left. Depending on where you move up from the crack, the difficuly of this climb can change by a couple of grades.

The name

Rythym Of The Heat

comes from a Peter Gabriel song of the same name from his 1982 Security release.
content.protection: None -  free solo or TR from bolts and large gear (long slings necessary)

climbs.name: Pixie Stick
climbs.fa: Mike Beck and Alan Nelson, December 1982

content.description: Climb a left slanting ramp and face to wispy cracks and finish with an easy crack past several ledges.
content.location:
Located just right of

Silent but Deadly

on the right margin of the featured face.

content.description: Easy climbing past a couple of bolts leads into the business which involves technical moves up and over the bulge and onto the slab above. Once established on the slab run it out to the anchors.
content.location: On the far left side of Pixie Rock's South Face in a scooped out area.

content.description:
Interesting, the crux is the left leaning section in the middle. Â More a mental crux than a tech/physical crux.

Follow the right leaning crack to the right side of the wall, then switch to the left leaning crack until it meets Whos first, then straight to the top.
content.protection: Solo or TR, if you wanted to try, it might be a trad lead.
content.location: Overlaps Rhythm of the heat, between Whos first and Silent scream.
